text: Bentley is a city in Sedgwick County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 560 people lived there. ==History== Bentley was planned out in 1888. This was when the Kansas Midland Railway was built to that point. It was named after Orsemus Hills Bentley, a railroad official. The first post office in Bentley was created in March 1888. ==Geography== Bentley is at (37.886437, -97.517133). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 560 people, 205 households, and 154 families living in Bentley. Of the households, 82.4% owned their home and 17.6% rented their home. The median age was 35.8 years. Of the people, 86.1% were White, 1.4% were Native American, 0.7% were Black, 0.2% were Pacific Islanders, 4.6% were from some other race, and 7.0% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 7.5% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 530 people, 199 households, and 142 families living in Bentley. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Bentley * Bentley - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 440, local school district * USD 440 School District Boundary Map , KDOT ;Maps * Bentley City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Sedgwick County, Kansas Category:1888 establishments in Kansas
